Explanations about Options.-C(M):
Change to DIR before performing any operations. This option is order-sensitive,
 i.e. it affects all options that follow.
Explanations about Options.-x(M):
Extract files from an archive. Arguments are optional. When given, they specify
 names of the archive members to be extracted.

Answers.Most Similar TLDR Task: Extract a (compressed) archive into the current directory

Explanations about Options.-n(M): do not overwrite an existing file

Answers.Most Similar TLDR Task: Do not overwrite existing files at the target
Top-3 Scripts:
so_15744023: mv filename.tar.gz filename.tar # optional
tar xvf filename.tar

so_35401363: $ source=~/tmp/source   # directory where .gz files will be created
$ target=~/tmp/target   # target directory for uncompressed files
$ archive=~/tmp/archive # archive dir for .gz files
$ shopt -s nullglob     # avoid retiring unexpanded paths
$ for gz in ${source}/*.gz ; do gzip -dc "$gz" > ${target}/$(basename "$gz" .gz) ; mv "$gz" ${archive}/ ; done
$ shopt -u nullglob     # reset nullglob

find ${source} -name '*.gz' -print0 | while read -d '' -r gz; do
    gzip -dc "$gz" > ${target}/$(basename "$gz" .gz)
    mv "$gz" ${archive}/
done

Explanations about Options.-f(M):
Specify archive as the pathname of the input or output archive, overriding the
 default standard input (for list and read) or standard output (for write). A single
 archive may span multiple files and different archive devices. When required, pax
 will prompt for the pathname of the file or device of the next volume in the
 archive.
